discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Toner Probe

Selected Answer: C
The technician connects the tone generator to the Cat 6 cable at one end. The tone generator sends a signal or tone through the cable.
The technician then uses the probe to scan the network rack and listen for the tone. When the probe is near the cable carrying the tone, it emits an audible sound, helping the technician identify the correct cable among the mess of cables in the rack.

questions.question_text: A network technician is working to locate an end user's Cat 6 cable within a network rack. The server rack is poorly documented, and a cable management system has not been implemented. Which of the following would be the BEST tool to BEST identify the correct cable?

A technician connects a new computer to the internet and then opens the wiring closet. Even though all of the wires are terminated, nothing in the wiring closet is labeled. Which of the following tools should the technician use to complete the task?

discussion.content:
C
A toner probe is a tool that can be used to trace and identify cables in a wiring closet. The technician can use a toner probe to find the cable that connects the new computer to the internet. A cable tester is a tool that can be used to check the continuity and quality of a cable. A loopback plug is a tool that can be used to test network ports or cables by sending and receiving signals from the same device. A punchdown tool is a tool that can be used to terminate wires into a patch panel or jack.

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer, of course.

Selected Answer: C
To complete the task of identifying and labeling cables in the wiring closet where nothing is currently labeled, the technician should use:

C. Toner probe.

Explanation:

A toner probe (Option C) is a tool used to trace and identify cables in a network or wiring system. The toner is connected to one end of the cable, and the technician uses the probe to trace the corresponding cable in the wiring closet. This helps in identifying and labeling cables.

comments.content: Can't be A. To use a cable tester you would have to disconnect every cable to test causing service disruptions. You need to trace the cable without disrupting service and to do so you would use a Toner probe so C is correct.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Is A cable tester cuz it’s not labeled

A. Legacy software is the best use case for client-side virtualization.

Client-side virtualization, also known as application virtualization, allows you to run older applications in a virtual environment on a newer operating system. This is particularly useful for legacy software that may not be compatible with modern operating systems.

Here's why the other options are less suitable:

B. Email: Email clients are generally compatible with modern operating systems and don't require virtualization.
C. Directory services: Directory services are typically server-based and not suitable for client-side virtualization.
D. Database: Databases often require specific hardware and software configurations and are not typically virtualized on client machines.
By using client-side virtualization, organizations can continue to use legacy applications without compromising the security and stability of their modern operating systems.

GG

Selected Answer: A
VMs are often used for old software.

comments.content: Ridiculous answer, nobody uses VMs for email, the answer is obviously A
No, email is server side. Question asks about client side so in this case A. Legacy software is correct.

discussion.content: B Email

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the BEST use case for client-side virtualization?

discussion.content:

Certain Molex connectors are used for providing power to the motherboard, fans, floppy disk drive, CD/DVD drive, video card, some older hard drive models, and more.

source:

DB9 connectors were commonly used for serial peripheral devices like keyboards, mice, joysticks, etc.

A & B are clearly not it

D: Molex is the correct one

questions.question_text: An IT technician is inspecting the internal components of a desktop computer to assess a suspected power issue with the motherboard. Which of the following connectors should the IT technician inspect further?

choices.C: Establish a theory of probable cause for the email server issue.
choices.A: Escalate the ticket to a higher level to resolve the email server issue.
choices.B: Test a theory to determine the cause of the email server issue.
choices.D: Create a plan of action to resolve the email server issue.

comments.content: the sys admin did not establish that theory, the coworker just discovered that.
"The coworker also discovered the email server's retention policy was updated shortly before users first noticed the issue." This is the theory.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I do not believe a theory was established yet. The problem was identified, but as for an actual solution to the problem, nothing seems to be stated.

C
Before attempting to resolve the issue, it is important to first determine the cause or probable cause of the issue, so that a plan of action can be developed. In this case, the fact that the retention policy was updated shortly before users first noticed the issue suggests that this could be the cause of the issue. The systems administrator should investigate this further to determine if this is indeed the cause of the email server issue.

Selected Answer: B
Given the context, the next logical step for the systems administrator would be to test a theory to determine the cause of the email server issue (Option B). Since the coworker already gathered facts and identified a potential cause (the updated retention policy), the administrator should now test this theory to confirm if it is indeed the root cause of the problem.

Option C, which involves establishing a theory of probable cause, would typically come before testing the theory. Since the theory has already been established (the retention policy update), the next step is to test it.

Selected Answer: C
Everything described in the question is the initial information being gathered which you would then use to establish a theory of probable cause.

Selected Answer: B
Since the coworker has already gathered facts and identified that the retention policy was updated shortly before the issue was noticed, the next logical step is to test a theory based on this information. This involves verifying if the updated retention policy is indeed causing the missing emails.

Selected Answer: C
C : The user gathers the information, and now they need to elaborate on a theory.

comments.content:
Thank you for explaining it. Wondering why it is not B.
The question steps is 1. Identify the problem 1a) gather information from the user and changes. 1b) inquire regarding environmental or infrastructure changes. 
Part 1b is still part of Identify the problem and I took the "discovered" as a establish a theory step 2

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The fact it says the retention policy was “discovered” tells me that this is just the collection of facts, something done in step 1. It doesn’t state anywhere that the coworker had thought the retention policy was the culprit, just that it was “discovered”. I’m thinking the next step is step 2, C. Establish a theory of probable cause.

Selected Answer: B
The theory is already established and now it is time to test the theorie, so the answer is B.

Selected Answer: C
I think it's C because where did they establish a theory yet. They ID'd the problem and that's all so far

Selected Answer: B
Problem Id'd (missing email). theory of probable cause established (Recent update). next is to test this theory
No theory of probable cause was established yet. Only states info on the investigation. So i would go for C in this case.

Selected Answer: B
How is this answer right. Answer is b

questions.question_text: A systems administrator is attempting to resolve a ticket regarding an issue with an email server. The administrator is covering for a coworker who was previously working on the ticket. The coworker already gathered facts about the issue and spoke with users concerning their missing emails. The coworker also discovered the email server's retention policy was updated shortly before users first noticed the issue. Which of the following should the systems administrator do NEXT to resolve the email issue?
